newsitem.title: CHINA: China expects 48.9 pct of auto sales to be private.
newsitem.headline: China expects 48.9 pct of auto sales to be private.

text.p: Private buyers are expected to account for 48.9 percent of automobile sales in 1997, the China news service said on Tuesday.
Total domestic demand for automobiles in 1997 was estimated at 1.62 million, up by 170,000 compared with last year and with cars accounting for 38 percent, it said.
Competition in the automobile industry was expected to remain stiff in 1997, mainly because of overproduction, the news service said.
Excessive fees imposed in the purchase and use of cars were limiting demand, it said.
China's automobile production in 1996 reached 1.54 million vehicles, of which 389,200 were cars.
Officials figures say the number of individual car purchases has grown by 51 percent a year since 1992, bringing the total number of privately-owned vehicles to 2.5 million at the end of last year.
